004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonAutoDetect;
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonCreator;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.interpolation.Interpolatable;
013import java.util.Objects;
014
015/**
016 * Represents a translation in 2D space. This object can be used to represent a point or a vector.
017 *
018 * <p>This assumes that you are using conventional mathematical axes. When the robot is at the
019 * origin facing in the positive X direction, forward is positive X and left is positive Y.
020 */
021@SuppressWarnings({"ParameterName", "MemberName"})
022@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
023@JsonAutoDetect(getterVisibility = JsonAutoDetect.Visibility.NONE)
024public class Translation2d implements Interpolatable<Translation2d> {
025  private final double m_x;
026  private final double m_y;
027
028  /** Constructs a Translation2d with X and Y components equal to zero. */
029  public Translation2d() {
030    this(0.0, 0.0);
031  }
032
033  /**
034   * Constructs a Translation2d with the X and Y components equal to the provided values.
035   *
036   * @param x The x component of the translation.
037   * @param y The y component of the translation.
038   */
039  @JsonCreator
040  public Translation2d(
041      @JsonProperty(required = true, value = "x") double x,
042      @JsonProperty(required = true, value = "y") double y) {
043    m_x = x;
044    m_y = y;
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Constructs a Translation2d with the provided distance and angle. This is essentially converting
049   * from polar coordinates to Cartesian coordinates.
050   *
051   * @param distance The distance from the origin to the end of the translation.
052   * @param angle The angle between the x-axis and the translation vector.
053   */
054  public Translation2d(double distance, Rotation2d angle) {
055    m_x = distance * angle.getCos();
056    m_y = distance * angle.getSin();
057  }
058
059  /**
060   * Calculates the distance between two translations in 2D space.
061   *
062   * <p>The distance between translations is defined as √((x₂−x₁)²+(y₂−y₁)²).
063   *
064   * @param other The translation to compute the distance to.
065   * @return The distance between the two translations.
066   */
067  public double getDistance(Translation2d other) {
068    return Math.hypot(other.m_x - m_x, other.m_y - m_y);
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Returns the X component of the translation.
073   *
074   * @return The X component of the translation.
075   */
076  @JsonProperty
077  public double getX() {
078    return m_x;
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * Returns the Y component of the translation.
083   *
084   * @return The Y component of the translation.
085   */
086  @JsonProperty
087  public double getY() {
088    return m_y;
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Returns the norm, or distance from the origin to the translation.
093   *
094   * @return The norm of the translation.
095   */
096  public double getNorm() {
097    return Math.hypot(m_x, m_y);
098  }
099
100  /**
101   * Returns the angle this translation forms with the positive X axis.
102   *
103   * @return The angle of the translation
104   */
105  public Rotation2d getAngle() {
106    return new Rotation2d(m_x, m_y);
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Applies a rotation to the translation in 2D space.
111   *
112   * <p>This multiplies the translation vector by a counterclockwise rotation matrix of the given
113   * angle.
114   *
115   * <pre>
116   * [x_new]   [other.cos, -other.sin][x]
117   * [y_new] = [other.sin,  other.cos][y]
118   * </pre>
119   *
120   * <p>For example, rotating a Translation2d of &lt;2, 0&gt; by 90 degrees will return a
121   * Translation2d of &lt;0, 2&gt;.
122   *
123   * @param other The rotation to rotate the translation by.
124   * @return The new rotated translation.
125   */
126  public Translation2d rotateBy(Rotation2d other) {
127    return new Translation2d(
128        m_x * other.getCos() - m_y * other.getSin(), m_x * other.getSin() + m_y * other.getCos());
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * Returns the sum of two translations in 2D space.
133   *
134   * <p>For example, Translation3d(1.0, 2.5) + Translation3d(2.0, 5.5) = Translation3d{3.0, 8.0).
135   *
136   * @param other The translation to add.
137   * @return The sum of the translations.
138   */
139  public Translation2d plus(Translation2d other) {
140    return new Translation2d(m_x + other.m_x, m_y + other.m_y);
141  }
142
143  /**
144   * Returns the difference between two translations.
145   *
146   * <p>For example, Translation2d(5.0, 4.0) - Translation2d(1.0, 2.0) = Translation2d(4.0, 2.0).
147   *
148   * @param other The translation to subtract.
149   * @return The difference between the two translations.
150   */
151  public Translation2d minus(Translation2d other) {
152    return new Translation2d(m_x - other.m_x, m_y - other.m_y);
153  }
154
155  /**
156   * Returns the inverse of the current translation. This is equivalent to rotating by 180 degrees,
157   * flipping the point over both axes, or negating all components of the translation.
158   *
159   * @return The inverse of the current translation.
160   */
161  public Translation2d unaryMinus() {
162    return new Translation2d(-m_x, -m_y);
163  }
164
165  /**
166   * Returns the translation multiplied by a scalar.
167   *
168   * <p>For example, Translation2d(2.0, 2.5) * 2 = Translation2d(4.0, 5.0).
169   *
170   * @param scalar The scalar to multiply by.
171   * @return The scaled translation.
172   */
173  public Translation2d times(double scalar) {
174    return new Translation2d(m_x * scalar, m_y * scalar);
175  }
176
177  /**
178   * Returns the translation divided by a scalar.
179   *
180   * <p>For example, Translation3d(2.0, 2.5) / 2 = Translation3d(1.0, 1.25).
181   *
182   * @param scalar The scalar to multiply by.
183   * @return The reference to the new mutated object.
184   */
185  public Translation2d div(double scalar) {
186    return new Translation2d(m_x / scalar, m_y / scalar);
187  }
188
189  @Override
190  public String toString() {
191    return String.format("Translation2d(X: %.2f, Y: %.2f)", m_x, m_y);
192  }
193
194  /**
195   * Checks equality between this Translation2d and another object.
196   *
197   * @param obj The other object.
198   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
199   */
200  @Override
201  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
202    if (obj instanceof Translation2d) {
203      return Math.abs(((Translation2d) obj).m_x - m_x) < 1E-9
204          && Math.abs(((Translation2d) obj).m_y - m_y) < 1E-9;
205    }
206    return false;
207  }
208
209  @Override
210  public int hashCode() {
211    return Objects.hash(m_x, m_y);
212  }
213
214  @Override
215  public Translation2d interpolate(Translation2d endValue, double t) {
216    return new Translation2d(
217        MathUtil.interpolate(this.getX(), endValue.getX(), t),
218        MathUtil.interpolate(this.getY(), endValue.getY(), t));
219  }
220}
